bibl.title: Henry Carlton v. William Cochrane. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

text.body:
In the Justice Court before N. Soderberg, Justice of the Peace in and for Seattle Precinct King County, W.T.
Territory of Washington Plaintiff vs. Henry Carlton Defendant
Commitment
United States of America Territory of Washington }ss County of King
I, H.G. Thornton Contable of said Precinct and the Keeper of the jail of said King County.
Whereas at the Justices Court held at my office in said King County for the trial of Henry Carlton for the offense here inafter stated the said Henry Carlton was convicted of having on the 13th day of April 1888 committed the crime of vagrancy by wilfully and unlawfully pursuing the business of gambling as a common /// and upon conviction the said court did adjudge and determine that said Henry Carlton should pay the costs herein taxed at $40.00 and stand committed for 13 days or until the same be paid and should give a bond or recognizance to the Territory of Washington with two sufficient sureties in the sum
of Two Hundred and fifty Dollars for his good behavior for 3 months from April 14th 1888 the date of the judgement herein and whereas said Henry Carlton has failed to pay said costs and has failed to give or furnish said or any bond or recognizance as in said judgement required
Therefor you the said H.G. Thornton are hereby commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said Henry Carlton to the said Keeper and you the said Keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said Henry Carlton into your custody in said Jail and him there keep until he shall thence be discharged by due course of law.
Dated this 24th day of April 1888 N. Soderberg Justice of the Peace
Endorsed- 541 Territory of Washington vs Henry Carlton Commitment
